title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 45-2.5 - Identification and rating plates
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 45-2.5 - Identification and rating plates

State Regulations
(a) Every amusement device shall be
identified by a trade or descriptive name and an identification number. A metal
plate upon which there is legibly impressed the name and number of the device, its model number if any and the name and address of its manufacturer shall be
firmly attached to the device in a readily visible location. The maximum safe
number of passengers and the maximum safe speed, where applicable, shall be
legibly impressed on the same plate or another metal plate. (b) Each passenger carrying car, seat, etc. in an amusement device or temporary structure shall be identified with an
identification number in a readily visible location. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
45-2.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
